FuncDef:
The qos car outbound command applies a QoS CAR profile to an interface in the outbound direction to police traffic on the interface.
The undo qos car outbound command unbinds a QoS CAR profile from an interface in the outbound direction. The qos car outbound command applies a QoS CAR profile to an interface in the outbound direction to police traffic on the interface. The undo qos car outbound command unbinds a QoS CAR profile from an interface in the outbound direction. By default, no QoS CAR profile is applied to an interface. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a QoS CAR profile.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo: After a QoS CAR profile is created, you can run the qos car outbound command to apply the QoS CAR profile to an interface in the outbound direction to police traffic leaving the interface.
